name: Hardtimes Machine Learning Journal Club
body:
## Welcome to UCSB Physics' Machine Learning Journal Club.

This is the webpage for the UCSB physics journal club devoted to learning more about learning with machines and making those machines solve physics problems for us. We meet Tuesdays, 10am.

### Talks

Currently we've had one presentation. You can view the Jupyter notebook at the provided link. As other talks happen we'll (hopefully) upload the notes/notebooks for reference.

#### Next Talk
  * November 22

#### Previous Talks
  * November 11: [Introduction to Restricted Boltzmann Machines](https://github.com/HardtimesMachineLearningJournalClub/Meeting1-RBMs), Katie Hyatt

### Worth Reading

#### Condensed matter physics with machine learning
  * [Learning Thermodynamics with Boltzmann Machines](https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.02718)
  * [Machine learning quantum phases of matter beyond the fermion sign problem](https://arxiv.org/abs/1608.07848)
  * [Machine Learning Phases of Strongly Correlated Fermions](https://arxiv.org/abs/1609.02552)
  * [Self-Learning Monte Carlo Method](https://arxiv.org/abs/1610.03137)
  * [Accelerate Monte Carlo Simulations with Restricted Boltzmann Machines](https://arxiv.org/abs/1610.02746)

#### General Machine Learning
  * [A Practical Guide to Training Restricted Boltzmann Machines (PDF)](https://www.cs.toronto.edu/~hinton/absps/guideTR.pdf)
  * [A Beginner's Tutorial for Restricted Boltzmann Machines](https://deeplearning4j.org/restrictedboltzmannmachine)
  * [A Beginner's Guide to Understanding Convolutional Neural Networks](https://adeshpande3.github.io/adeshpande3.github.io/A-Beginner's-Guide-To-Understanding-Convolutional-Neural-Networks/) (the whole series is worth reading!)
  * [Convolutional Neural Networks](http://cs231n.github.io/convolutional-networks/) Stanford CS introduction to CNNs for image recognition.
  * [An Intuitive Explanation of Convolutional Neural Networks](https://ujjwalkarn.me/2016/08/11/intuitive-explanation-convnets/)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
